summary:
Didn't know how much I needed this until I saw it, they're all so precious and Benedict I love you, u know that.
I'm laughing my...
caption:
Didn’t know how much I needed this until I saw it, they’re all so precious and Benedict I love you, u know that.
I’m laughing my bones off cause of the last part when tom hiddleston shows up with ‘hello brother’ and then Chris 'shut up’ my goodness I stan them

Cred: the tonight show starring jimmy fallon

summary: Friendly Neighbourhood Spider-Man Okay, so I was supposed to do something completely different, but I got sidetracked by...
caption:
Friendly Neighbourhood Spider-Man

Okay, so I was supposed to do something completely different, but I got sidetracked by Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017) and my plans flew out of the metaphorical window. So you can blame or thank Marvel, whichever you prefer. But here you have it!

You can find the full quality picture on my DeviantArt!

And you can watch the SPEEDPAINT here!

If  you ike what I do, consider buying me a coffee! :)

summary: It's so fucking weird how all of us somehow had the same exact nightmare one night and collectively decided to name it Avengers...
body:
It’s so fucking weird how all of us somehow had the same exact nightmare one night and collectively decided to name it Avengers Infinity war.

That’s wild.

blog.name: spiderbabypxrker
blog.title: Spider Baby
blog.description: Peter Parker deserves the world and more ~ masterlist

summary: Perfectly Wrong: Peter Parker x Reader Imagine
title: Perfectly Wrong: Peter Parker x Reader Imagine
body:
Where his love is for someone else who isn’t you.

Word Count: 1106

Warnings: none

a/n: Haii everyone! This story is inspired by a song by Shawn Mendes “Perfectly Wrong”, it’s a really good song and I’ll leave the link here if you’d like to listen to it. I hate ending stories like this, it’s so unsatisfying but it is very true in a sense that not everything is a fairy tail. Send in any prompts or requests if you’d like, I really need to write something fluffy. All I write is angst and sad stuff heh…anywaysss I hope you like this imagine, thank youuuu :)

masterlist

—————-

Taste the poison from your lips

Lately, we’re as good as gone

Oh, our love is drunk and it’s

Singing me my favourite song

You knew what you were getting into when you chose to enter his world. His embrace seemed like paradise, a warm summer breeze against your skin. He was beautiful, inviting and the thrill you always wanted in life. You craved to feel his touch, the taste of his lips, his intoxicating presence just made your whole world spin.

The way he spoke made you feel so important. Repeatedly dropping everything just to listen to you talk about your day. Telling you corny science jokes just to make you smile. Even when he would cuddle into your chest when he was upset and hold onto you like you were his only life support. You wanted him, all of him.

He is everything. Everything that could ever matter in your universe.

But you were not meant for him.

Because his eyes were always set upon someone else, someone who wasn’t you.

Me and you

We were made to break

I know that’s true

But it’s much too late

You can hear him at your window, his silhouette highlighted by the moon casting a shadow in your dark room. You had drawn the curtains closed, knowing that he would come after his night of being Spiderman. You had been avoiding him all day, and it wasn’t because you hated him, you could never hate him. But every time you looked at him, you were reminded of the things you couldn’t have.

He knocked frantically, attempting to gain your attention. But he always did, that was the problem. Your attention was always on him, you woke up and went to sleep thinking of him and his dimpled smile.

His desperate pleas vibrate through the door and your heart tears apart at each and every cry that leaves his parted lips.

“(Y/N), please open the door and talk to me. I don’t understand what’s going on,” Peter calls out with confusion laced in his tone.

You’re perfectly wrong for me

And that’s why it’s so hard to leave

Yeah, you’re perfectly wrong for me

You’re perfectly wrong for me

All the stars in the sky could see

Why you’re perfectly wrong for me

You stand up from your spot curled up on the floor, walking over to the window with glassy eyes. With your hand, you push back the curtain, making eye contact with Peter who clung to your window in his spider suit.

“Peter, please just go. I don’t want to talk to anyone right now.”

He furrowed his eyebrows, “No I’m not leaving you, we’re going to talk now because you’re clearly upset and I want you to be okay. I don’t care if I have to yell through the window,” he presses, not budging from his position.

His caring words struck your heart and you felt even weaker than before. How could he be so blind?

“Peter, please just go,” you repeat desperately, trying to hold back the sobs threatening to spill from your mouth.  

He shakes his head, “I’m not leaving, I’ll stay here all night if I have to.”

Oh, you know how much it hurts

Every time you say you hate me

But when we’re making love, you make it worth it

I can’t believe the places that you take me

A frustrated sigh leaves your parted lips, unlocking your window to let Peter in. You turn away from his presence, not wanting to look him in the eye because you couldn’t without breaking down. He shouldn’t see you cry, he shouldn’t be here in the first place.

His hand comes up to grasp your shoulder, spinning you around to face him.

“(Y/N), talk to me, please, did someone say something to you?” he asks curiously, pulling you a little closer so you wouldn’t walk away.

You shake your head in response.

“Did I do something?” he questions.

Again, you shake your head, “No,” you lie.

“Then what is it, I can’t help you if I don’t know what’s wrong,” he continues, the genuine concern in his tone made you almost sick. You felt worthless all because of the curly-haired, light-eyed boy that stood in front of you.

But he knew nothing, he was completely oblivious to your feelings. Completely oblivious to the gnawing words that so desperately wanted to be acknowledged by him.

I love you.

I love you so much.

But you were so scared, scared of rejection. Scared of the pain that would come with it. Because deep down you knew that she would always be the one that he would think about, the one he wants to spend every second with, the one he wants a future with.

There’s no use

We were made to break

I know the truth

And it’s much too late

Your lack of response frustrates him, he sighs, pulling you into his warm embrace. Holding you close to his chest with desperation. Desperation to ease your mind of whatever demons that haunted it, but he didn’t know, your discomfort all came from him.

For a moment, you were able to see yourself with him, cuddles and kisses, movie nights and dinners. But it faded away as fast as it came.

You let out a shaky breath, containing all your emotions as you stared back at his hazelnut eyes.

“Peter, thank you for your concern, but, I’m okay…well I’ll be okay,” the words were painful to say and his presence was becoming intoxicatingly consuming.

He steps back a little, hands still wrapped around your arms. He frowns, scanning your face for any sort of sign of discomfort, “Will you promise me something?”

You nod slowly and he continues, “If whatever this is, whatever is making you upset, gets worse, please come and talk to me.”

I’m afraid it’s already worse Peter.

You nod, trying to make it convincing. He smiles softly, hugging you again.

“I know you’ll be okay,” he whispers into your hair, “You’re so incredibly strong.”

He left you in your bedroom, staring back at the open window with a heavy heart and an unlimited amount of tears.

And even though it killed you to see him with her, or talk about her.

You would stick around.

Because you love him.

You love him so much.

Oh, and why can’t I quit

When you break my heart open

I need you more than I know

Oh

And I can’t resist

When you’re up against my skin

I never want to let you go

You’re perfectly wrong for me…

reblog.comment:

But every time you looked at him, you were reminded of the things you couldn’t have.

He knocked frantically, attempting to gain your attention. But he always did, that was the problem. Your attention was always on him, you woke up and went to sleep thinking of him and his dimpled smile.

His desperate pleas vibrate through the door and your heart tears apart at each and every cry that leaves his parted lips.

“(Y/N), please open the door and talk to me. I don’t understand what’s going on,” Peter calls out with confusion laced in his tone.

You’re perfectly wrong for me

And that’s why it’s so hard to leave

Yeah, you’re perfectly wrong for me

You’re perfectly wrong for me

All the stars in the sky could see

Why you’re perfectly wrong for me

You stand up from your spot curled up on the floor, walking over to the window with glassy eyes. With your hand, you push back the curtain, making eye contact with Peter who clung to your window in his spider suit.

“Peter, please just go. I don’t want to talk to anyone right now.”

He furrowed his eyebrows, “No I’m not leaving you, we’re going to talk now because you’re clearly upset and I want you to be okay. I don’t care if I have to yell through the window,” he presses, not budging from his position.

His caring words struck your heart and you felt even weaker than before. How could he be so blind?

“Peter, please just go,” you repeat desperately, trying to hold back the sobs threatening to spill from your mouth.  

He shakes his head, “I’m not leaving, I’ll stay here all night if I have to.”

Oh, you know how much it hurts

Every time you say you hate me

But when we’re making love, you make it worth it

I can’t believe the places that you take me

A frustrated sigh leaves your parted lips, unlocking your window to let Peter in. You turn away from his presence, not wanting to look him in the eye because you couldn’t without breaking down. He shouldn’t see you cry, he shouldn’t be here in the first place.

His hand comes up to grasp your shoulder, spinning you around to face him.

“(Y/N), talk to me, please, did someone say something to you?” he asks curiously, pulling you a little closer so you wouldn’t walk away.

You shake your head in response.

“Did I do something?” he questions.

Again, you shake your head, “No,” you lie.

“Then what is it, I can’t help you if I don’t know what’s wrong,” he continues, the genuine concern in his tone made you almost sick. You felt worthless all because of the curly-haired, light-eyed boy that stood in front of you.

But he knew nothing, he was completely oblivious to your feelings. Completely oblivious to the gnawing words that so desperately wanted to be acknowledged by him.

I love you.

I love you so much.

But you were so scared, scared of rejection. Scared of the pain that would come with it. Because deep down you knew that she would always be the one that he would think about, the one he wants to spend every second with, the one he wants a future with.

There’s no use

We were made to break

I know the truth

And it’s much too late

Your lack of response frustrates him, he sighs, pulling you into his warm embrace. Holding you close to his chest with desperation. Desperation to ease your mind of whatever demons that haunted it, but he didn’t know, your discomfort all came from him.

For a moment, you were able to see yourself with him, cuddles and kisses, movie nights and dinners. But it faded away as fast as it came.

You let out a shaky breath, containing all your emotions as you stared back at his hazelnut eyes.

“Peter, thank you for your concern, but, I’m okay…well I’ll be okay,” the words were painful to say and his presence was becoming intoxicatingly consuming.

He steps back a little, hands still wrapped around your arms. He frowns, scanning your face for any sort of sign of discomfort, “Will you promise me something?”

You nod slowly and he continues, “If whatever this is, whatever is making you upset, gets worse, please come and talk to me.”

I’m afraid it’s already worse Peter.

You nod, trying to make it convincing. He smiles softly, hugging you again.

“I know you’ll be okay,” he whispers into your hair, “You’re so incredibly strong.”

He left you in your bedroom, staring back at the open window with a heavy heart and an unlimited amount of tears.

And even though it killed you to see him with her, or talk about her.

You would stick around.

Because you love him.

You love him so much.

Oh, and why can’t I quit

When you break my heart open

I need you more than I know

Oh

And I can’t resist

When you’re up against my skin

I never want to let you go

You’re perfectly wrong for me…
trail.content:
Where his love is for someone else who isn’t you.

Word Count: 1106

Warnings: none

a/n: Haii everyone! This story is inspired by a song by Shawn Mendes “Perfectly Wrong”, it’s a really good song and I’ll leave the link here if you’d like to listen to it. I hate ending stories like this, it’s so unsatisfying but it is very true in a sense that not everything is a fairy tail. Send in any prompts or requests if you’d like, I really need to write something fluffy. All I write is angst and sad stuff heh…anywaysss I hope you like this imagine, thank youuuu :)

masterlist

—————-

Taste the poison from your lips

Lately, we’re as good as gone

Oh, our love is drunk and it’s

Singing me my favourite song

You knew what you were getting into when you chose to enter his world. His embrace seemed like paradise, a warm summer breeze against your skin. He was beautiful, inviting and the thrill you always wanted in life. You craved to feel his touch, the taste of his lips, his intoxicating presence just made your whole world spin.

The way he spoke made you feel so important. Repeatedly dropping everything just to listen to you talk about your day. Telling you corny science jokes just to make you smile. Even when he would cuddle into your chest when he was upset and hold onto you like you were his only life support. You wanted him, all of him.

He is everything. Everything that could ever matter in your universe.

But you were not meant for him.

Because his eyes were always set upon someone else, someone who wasn’t you.

Me and you

We were made to break

I know that’s true

But it’s much too late

You can hear him at your window, his silhouette highlighted by the moon casting a shadow in your dark room. You had drawn the curtains closed, knowing that he would come after his night of being Spiderman. You had been avoiding him all day, and it wasn’t because you hated him, you could never hate him. A frustrated sigh leaves your parted lips, unlocking your window to let Peter in. You turn away from his presence, not wanting to look him in the eye because you couldn’t without breaking down. He shouldn’t see you cry, he shouldn’t be here in the first place.

His hand comes up to grasp your shoulder, spinning you around to face him.

“(Y/N), talk to me, please, did someone say something to you?” he asks curiously, pulling you a little closer so you wouldn’t walk away.

You shake your head in response.

“Did I do something?” he questions.

Again, you shake your head, “No,” you lie.

“Then what is it, I can’t help you if I don’t know what’s wrong,” he continues, the genuine concern in his tone made you almost sick. You felt worthless all because of the curly-haired, light-eyed boy that stood in front of you.

I love you so much.

Your lack of response frustrates him, he sighs, pulling you into his warm embrace. Holding you close to his chest with desperation. Desperation to ease your mind of whatever demons that haunted it, but he didn’t know, your discomfort all came from him.

For a moment, you were able to see yourself with him, cuddles and kisses, movie nights and dinners. But it faded away as fast as it came.

You nod slowly and he continues, “If whatever this is, whatever is making you upset, gets worse, please come and talk to me.”

“I know you’ll be okay,” he whispers into your hair, “You’re so incredibly strong.”

body:
Movie gifs

Lol @sacygnus you would challenge me to attempt to list my top 10 favorite movies… *sigh* ok, this list is in no particular order because I can’t rank my faves.

(I’ll also try to pick gifs from some of my favorite scenes too)

1. The last unicorn

2. Howl’s Moving Cadtle

3. Stardust

4. Star wars (New hope/Jedi)

5. Labyrinth

6. Avatar

7. Big Hero 6

8. Pokémon 2000

9. Spirited Away

10. The Avengers

And a bonus - because I couldn’t find a GIF

Star Trek Insurrection

https://youtu.be/N4x1K97JZG0

Tags are for anyone who wants to partake, but I’m especially interested in the responses from @redwerecat /@cephalopod-werecat , @amaranthine-daydream, @wildblueyoshi, @skrymmorie, @theoryofmyself, @guardian-of-thedas, & @parthelus
